p: AAV2‐vectors transencapsidated into AAV9 capsids were produced, and integrity and identity of the AAV9 capsids were verified using the conformational capsid antibody ADK9 ( Appendix Fig S1C and D; Sonntag et al, 2011). All vector stocks contained high amounts of encapsidated viral genomes (vg) and relatively low amounts of empty capsids ( Appendix Fig S1E and F). Correspondingly, robust in vitro AAV vector transduction rates were achieved (Fig 1D and Appendix Fig S1G).
